name: Crocus
description: Crocus is a genus of about 90 species of perennials in the Iridaceae family, native to Asia, North Africa, Mediterranean Europe and Alps.Majority of species are abundant in the wild, from rocky mountains and alpine meadows to woodlands and scrublands. The flowers are cup-shaped and mainly composed of six petals. They come in a variety of colors and are often the first to bloom in late winter or early spring. The true arrival of spring is frequently marked by the bright colors of the Crocus.
meaning: The genus name is derived from “krokos”, an ancient Greek name for saffron (Crocus sativus).
color_description: These flowers are white, cream, yellow, blue and purple, and there are even striped varieties.
